SENT.plain: AIM: To evaluate the effects of dihydropyridine calcium antagonists on the cerebral circulation in stroke patients
DESIGN OF STUDIES: Mean cerebral circulation parameters were studied in chronic stroke patients with hypertension and treated acutely or chronically (2 weeks) with nicardipine or nifedipine retard
The effects of nicardipine on local cerebral blood flow were also studied in patients with a subacute brain infarction
RESULTS: Mean cerebral blood flow was significantly increased after a single oral administration of nicardipine but not after nifedipine retard
Both calcium antagonists reduced mean arterial pressure
Nifedipine retard acted mainly by reducing blood pressure and nicardipine mainly by reducing cerebrovascular resistance
CONCLUSION: Dihydropyridines have a beneficial effect in the control of hypertension in stroke patients
